title: Retail Sales Fell In September. Is It Time to Worry About the U.S. Consumer?
text:
The American consumer—backed by strong wage growth—has offset weakness in corporate profits and capital spending for much of the past year. The Commerce Department’s latest update of retail and food service spending, published Wednesday, suggests the growth spurt is over.

The upshot? The slowdown could prompt a more vigorous “midcycle adjustment”—read: interest-rate cuts—by the Federal Reserve when it meets at the end of this month. The implied odds of a 0.25 percentage-point reduction are now at 90%, up from 74% on Tuesday.
